summary:
Japan's first people arrived around 38,000 years ago. The Jōmon period was followed by the Yayoi, when new ideas came from Asia. In the 3rd century BC, the Yayoi people brought iron and farming, quickly outgrowing the Jōmon.

In the 4th to 9th centuries, Japan united under an emperor. The Heian period (794-1185) was a cultural golden age. Over time, power shifted from the emperor to clans and military groups.

In the late 16th century, Japan united under Oda Nobunaga and Toyotomi Hideyoshi. The Tokugawa shogunate (1600-1868) brought peace but isolated Japan.

Contact with Portugal (1543) and the US (1853) ended isolation. The Meiji era (1868-1912) modernized Japan. After World War
